ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A serious work of historical scholarship.
i wrote a two semester senior essay, learned a lot about methodology.
Independent research, self-pacing a long assignment, drafting and re-drafting, clear writing, narrowing down an idea into a paper.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Would have appreciated a bit more support/ guidance from the department; having some pod study/ accountability groups; optional seminars on different tools, strategies, etc.

I wish there was more structure for history majors graduating off-sequence. All of the info sessions are in the fall and are intended for people starting a yearlong course. That being said, the way it's currently structured is better than if we had to attend a weekly class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you are a history major.
Yes! Best part about being a history major!
Necessary for the degree; would advise to have an informal advisor in addition to your formal one if the latter is a bit more hands-off
I enjoyed the freedom of this project. It felt like a culmination of my undergraduate studies.
